com.eyetechds.quicklink

Class QLCalibration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.eyetechds.quicklink.QLCalibration

  • public class QLCalibration
extends java.lang.Object
    A QLCalibration object is a container for holding calibration data used by QLDevice objects. There are two ways to fill the container with valid calibration data; it can be loaded from a file or it can be collected during a calibration sequence.

    Loading from a file
    Calibration data can be loaded from a file by using the method load(FileChannel). If the data in the file is valid then the container will hold valid calibration data after loading. The data in the file must have been written by using the method save(FileChannel) in order to be loaded correctly.

    Using a calibration sequence
    A calibration sequence temporarily links a calibration object with a device so that it can collect eye data from the device and use it for creating calibration data. A calibration sequence is performed by following these steps.

    1. Start the sequence by calling start(QLDevice, QLCalibrationType).
    2. Get the targets for the sequence by calling getTargets().
    3. For each target, display a graphic on the screen at the target location for the user to look at, then calibrate the target by calling calibrate(QLCalibrationTarget, int, boolean).
    4. Verify that the eyes have been calibrated at each target by calling getTargetStatus(QLCalibrationTarget). Re-calibrate a target if necessary.
    5. Verify that the calibration score is satisfactory by calling getScoring(QLCalibrationTarget, QLEyeType) for each target. Re-calibrate a target if necessary.
    6. When satisfied with the scores, finish the sequence by calling finish().

    Once a sequence is finished, the calibration object is no longer linked with the device. Linking a device to a calibration object for a calibration sequence has no affect on the gaze output from the device. A calibration must be applied to a device before it will be used by the device to calculate gaze data. A calibration is applied to a device by calling the method QLDevice.applyCalibration(QLCalibration).

    See Also:
    QLDevice

        Constructs a new empty QLCalibration object.

      • QLCalibration

        public QLCalibration(QLCalibration source)
        Constructs a new QLCalibration object. The calibration data from the source object is copied to the newly created object.
        Parameters:
        source - The source object from which the calibration will be coppied.

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public int load(java.nio.channels.FileChannel fileChannel)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Load calibration data from a file channel. The data is read from the current position of the file channel. The data in the file channel must have been created by calling save(FileChannel).

        The position of the file channel is incremented by the number of bytes read. If there is an error then the file channel's position is reset to where it was when this method was called.

        Parameters:
        fileChannel - A FileChannel from which the calibration will be loaded.

        Returns:
        The number of bytes read from the file channel or zero if there is an error. Call getLastError() to get further error information.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
        See Also:
        FileChannel

      • save

        public int save(java.nio.channels.FileChannel fileChannel)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Save calibration data to a file channel. The calibration data can later be loaded by calling load(FileChannel).

        The position of the file channel is incremented by the number of bytes written.

        Parameters:
        fileChannel - A FileChannel to which the calibration will be saved.

        Returns:
        The number of bytes written to the file channel. Call getLastError() to get further error information.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
        See Also:
        FileChannel

      • start

        public boolean start(QLDevice device,
            QLCalibrationType type)
        Start a new calibration sequence using the indicated device and calibration type. Previous calibration data is stored in temporary memory until finish() is called. A device can only be linked with one calibration object at a time. If the device was already linked with another calibration object then its link will become invalid and this object will obtain the link.
        Parameters:
        device - The device from which to receive calibration data. The device is obtained by calling the QLDevice.enumerate(Context) method.

        type - The type of calibration to perform.

        Returns:
        True, if the calibration object was successfully linked with the device. This indicates that the calibration sequence was started and is ready to continue.

        False, if there was an error. Call getLastError() to get further error information.

        See Also:
        QLDevice, QLCalibrationType

      • getTargets

        public QLCalibrationTarget[] getTargets()
        If a calibration sequence is currently active then this method will retrieve the targets for the calibration type of the current sequence. Otherwise this method will retrieve the targets for the existing calibration data.
        Returns:
        An array of QLCalibrationTarget objects that contain the data for the calibration points. If there was an error then null is returned. Call getLastError() to get further error information.
        See Also:
        QLCalibrationTarget

      • calibrate

        public boolean calibrate(QLCalibrationTarget target,
                int duration,
                boolean block)
        This method causes the calibration object to collect data from the device for the specified target. It should be called at least once for each target that was received by calling getTargets().

        If this method is called multiple times for the same target and not all targets have been calibrated then the data collected by the last call will overwrite previous data. If this function is called multiple times for the same target and all targets have been calibrated then the data collected by the last call will only overwrite the previous data if it improves the calibration overall.

        To successfully complete a calibration sequence this method must be called for each target after a calibration sequence has been started by calling start(QLDevice, QLCalibrationType) , but before it has been finished by calling finish().

        Parameters:
        target - The calibration target that the user is looking at. This is obtained by calling the getTargets() method. Usually there should be a target drawn on the screen at the position referenced by this target before calling this method.

        duration - The length of time that the calibration object will collect data from the device. For best results the user should be looking at the target position the entire time.

        block - A flag to determine whether this method should block. If this is true then the method will block and not return until the calibration object is done collecting data for the calibration target. If this is false then the method will return immediately and the status of the data collection can be determined by calling the getTargetStatus(QLCalibrationTarget) method.

        Returns:
        If this method blocks then a return value of true means that the duration has finished and that data was gathered for the target. If the method does not block then a return value of true means that calibration data collection was successfully started for the target.

        If there was an error then false is returned. Call getLastError() to get further error information.

        See Also:
        QLCalibrationTarget

      • getTargetStatus

        public QLCalibrationTargetStatus getTargetStatus(QLCalibrationTarget target)
        This method retrieves the status of a calibration target. It can be called before or after a calibration sequence has been finished by calling finish().
        Parameters:
        target - The calibration target whose status will be retrieved. This object is obtained by calling the method getTargets().

        Returns:
        A QLCalibrationTargetStatus object that contains the status of the calibration target. If there was an error then null is returned. Call getLastError() to get further error information.
        See Also:
        QLCalibrationTarget, QLCalibrationTargetStatus

      • getScoring

        public QLCalibrationScore getScoring(QLCalibrationTarget target,
                            QLEyeType eye)
        This method gets the the score of a calibration target for a particular eye. The eye must have been detected at least once for each target of the calibration in order to produce a score.

        This method can be called before or after a calibration sequence has been finished. Calling this method when a calibration sequence is not active will cause the calibration scores to be calculated from the existing calibration data. Calling this method when a calibration sequence is active will cause the calibration score to be calculated using the newly collected calibration data.

        Parameters:
        target - The target whose score will be retrieved. This object is obtained by calling getTargets().

        eye - The eye whose score should be retrieved.

        Returns:
        A QLCalibrationScore object that contains the calibration score for the desired eye. If there was an error then null is returned. Call getLastError() to get further error information.
        See Also:
        QLCalibrationScore, QLCalibrationTarget, QLEyeType

      • finish

        public boolean finish()
        This method finishes the calibration sequence after it is complete. It should be called when calibration data has been successfully collected at each target position and the target scores meet the user requirements. Any previous calibration data that was stored in the object is cleared and replaced with the new calibration data.
        Returns:
        True, if the calibration was successfully finished. False, if an error occurred. Call getLastError() to get further error information.
        See Also:
        start(QLDevice, QLCalibrationType), cancel()

      • cancel

        public boolean cancel()
        This method cancels a calibration sequence. Recently collected calibration data is cleared and the calibration container is restored to the state it was in before start(QLDevice, QLCalibrationType) was called.
        Returns:
        True, if the calibration was successfully canceled. False, if an error occurred. Call getLastError() to get further error information.
        See Also:
        start(QLDevice, QLCalibrationType), finish()

      • addBias

        public boolean addBias(QLEyeType eye,
              double xOffset,
              double yOffset)
        This method adds a bias offset to the stored calibration data in the object. For the new bias to affect the device, the calibration must be applied to the device by calling QLDevice.applyCalibration(QLCalibration) after this method is called.
        Parameters:
        eye - The eye to which the bias should be added.

        xOffset - The percent of the calibrated area in the x direction that the bias should offset the gaze output. Negative values will cause the resulting gaze point to be left of the current position. Positive values will cause the resulting gaze point to be right of the current position.

        yOffset - The percent of the calibrated area in the Y direction that the bias should offset the gaze output. Negative values will cause the resulting gaze point to be above the current position. Positive values will cause the resulting gaze point to be below the current position.

        Returns:
        True, if the bias was successfully added to the calibration object. False, otherwise. Call getLastError() to get further error information.
        See Also:
        QLEyeType, QLDevice

      • getLastError

        public QLError getLastError()
        This method gets the last error that occurred for the calibration.
        Returns:
        The last error that occurred.
        See Also:
        QLError
